snippet: Who will be the new mayor of London? One of the old ones.
abstract: Op-Ed article by writer A A Gill analyzes the brief history of London's mayoral office, which was created by Tony Blair in 2000; describes the mayoral race between Conservative incumbent Boris Johnson and former mayor Ken Livingstone, of the Labour party, and contends they have turned the job into one of oversight and patronage in a city with serious problems that need attention (M)
lead_paragraph: London Thursday London votes for a mayor. It is a contest between the only two people who have ever held the position: Ken Livingstone for Labour, who ran London from 2000 to 2008, and the Conservative Boris Johnson, the incumbent.
